programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Kansas (19-10, 10-8) is 4-7 on the road this season; Houston (25-4, 17-1) won eight-straight games behind the top scoring defense in the country, holding opponents to 58 ppg, and beat the Jayhawks, 92-86, in double overtime on Jan. 25.

programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: MLB Spring Training
programme.desc: New York beat Milwaukee in the Wild Card Series after finishing 89-73 in the NL East - six games behind the Phillies; St. Louis was 83-79 last season and finished 10 games behind Milwaukee in the NL Central.

programme.desc: Wake Forest (20-9, 12-6) ended its two-game skid with a 74-71 win over Notre Dame; Duke (26-3, 17-1) is 16-0 at home, and won 26 of its last 30 meetings with the Demon Deacons after a 63-56 win on Jan. 25 behind 24 points from Cooper Flagg.

programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: LSU (14-15, 3-13) dropped its last three games, but beat the Wildcats last season, 75-74; No. 19 Kentucky (19-10, 8-8) is 14-3 at home, and is top five in the country in scoring, averaging 85.3 ppg behind Otega Oweh, who leads the team with 15.7 ppg.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Christopher Bell secured his first win of the season with his victory at Atlanta over Carson Hocevar, while Ryan Blaney leads the standings; William Byron averaged 85.224 mph to win the race last year, beating Bell by 0.692 seconds.

programme.desc: Alex Palou won three races en route to his second-straight IndyCar Series title and third in the last four years, beating Colton Herta by 31 points; Pato O'Ward averaged 96.867 mph en route to his win at St. Petersburg last year over Will Power.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UCLA (20-9, 11-7) split its last six games after a 76-66 loss to then-No. 20 Purdue; Northwestern (16-13, 7-11) won three-straight games, and is 12-4 at home this season behind Nick Martinelli, who leads the Big Ten in scoring with 19.9 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UCLA (20-9, 11-7) split its last six games after a 76-66 loss to then-No. 20 Purdue; Northwestern (16-13, 7-11) won three-straight games, and is 12-4 at home this season behind Nick Martinelli, who leads the Big Ten in scoring with 19.9 ppg.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Jorge Martin finished on the podium in 16 of the 20 races to secure his first MotoGP Championship of his career, beating two-time defending champion Francesco Bagnaia by 10 points; Bagnaia won the race at Thailand last year over Martin.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Alex Palou won three races en route to his second-straight IndyCar Series title and third in the last four years, beating Colton Herta by 31 points; Pato O'Ward averaged 96.867 mph en route to his win at St. Petersburg last year over Will Power.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Creighton (20-9, 13-5) is 6-7 away from home, but won its last five meetings with the Pirates after a 79-54 win on Jan. 25 behind 23 points from Ryan Kalkbrenner, who is second in Big East scoring; Seton Hall (7-22, 2-16) dropped its last four games.

programme.title: FS1 College Hoops Extra
programme.desc: Hosts and analysts provide the latest highlights and scores to games in college basketball from around the country, providing analysis on the games that have concluded and going on, along with a preview of the upcoming matchups.

programme.desc: Columbus Crew SC qualified for the tournament after defeating LAFC in the 2024 Leagues Cup final, 3-1, on Aug. 25; Los Angeles FC advanced past Colorado Rapids on tournament away goals after its 1-0 victory in the second leg on Feb. 25.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Geelong seeks 11th and first premiership title since defeating Sydney, 133-52, in 2022; Brisbane won two of the three encounters last season, including a 95-85 victory in the Preliminary Finals, as Ollie Henry had four goals and 15 disposals.

programme.title: College Basketball

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Christopher Bell secured his first win of the season with his victory at Atlanta over Carson Hocevar, while Ryan Blaney leads the standings; William Byron averaged 85.224 mph to win the race last year, beating Bell by 0.692 seconds.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Tigres UANL defeated Nicaraguan club Real Estel, 3-0, in their second leg matchup on Feb. 12 to advance past the first round on aggregate, 3-1; FC Cincinnati defeated Honduran side FC Motagua on aggregate in the first round, 5-2.

programme.title: World Baseball Classic Qualifiers
programme.desc: Brazil, Colombia, Germany and China are competing in a four-team round-robin, and the top team automatically advances with a winner-moves-on final between the second- and third-place teams determining the second qualifier.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: EJ Tackett, who looks to win his 25th career title and move into a tie with Brian Voss for 11th all-time, leads the tour in points through two events; Graham Fach won the season opener.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Louis Foster dominated the 2024 season, winning eight of the final 11 races en route to his first NXT title over Jacob Abel by 122 points; Nolan Siegel opened 2024 with a victory at St. Petersburg over Abel for his lone win of the season.

programme.desc: Brazil, Colombia, Germany and China are competing in a four-team round-robin, and the top team automatically advances with a winner-moves-on final between the second- and third-place teams determining the second qualifier.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The winner in the semifinal matchup between E J Tackett and Timmy Tan, as well as the victor between Tim Foy Jr. and Dom Barrett advance to compete for the top prize of $30,000; Anthony Simonsen of Las Vegas took home the title in 2024.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Alajuelense qualified after winning the CONCACAF Central American Cup for the second-straight year in 2024; Pumas UNAM earned a 2-0 win over Cavalry FC on Feb. 13 to advance on aggregate in the first round, 3-2; inaugural meeting between the clubs.

programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.desc: Jorge Martin finished on the podium in 16 of the 20 races to secure his first MotoGP Championship of his career, beating two-time defending champion Francesco Bagnaia by 10 points; Enea Bastianini won the sprint race at Thailand last year.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: LA Galaxy is unbeaten in each of the two all-time encounters vs. El Team after securing a 4-1 victory in the second leg of their quarterfinal matchup in the 2012-13 edition of the tournament; Herediano advanced past Real Salt Lake on aggregate, 2-1.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory
Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory
Motocross
programme.desc: Wilson Logisitics Arena in Springfield, Missouri hosts the Arena Motocross Nationals for the second time of the season after round 5 in Memphis, Tennessee; Jacob Kurre earned a P3 in Memphis while Jalen McManis narrowly missed out on the main event.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Cruz Azul won the inaugural encounter against Seattle with an 11-0 victory in the 1996 CONCACAF Champions Cup, as Carlos Hermosillo and Julio Csar Yegros each notched a hat trick; Seattle Sounders advanced past Antigua GFC on aggregate, 6-2.
